page.title: 02ANIMALS & BIRDS.
page.content:
This area bounds with life of many kinds.The moorlands are the home of foxes,badgers,mountain hares,rabbits stoats,weasels & smaller mammals such as shrews,voles & mice.Probably the most common mammal is the Pygmy Shrew There are even some wallabies which were released during the last war. They are rarely seen as they move amongst the bracken.It is believed that their numbers have been reduced to about eleven because of bad winters &the weakening effect of in- breeding.Many birds make their home here from resident red grouse on the moors,herons by the reservoirs, various members of the tit family in the woods,to the migratory birds coming here for the summer such as redstarts,warblers &cuckoos.
e
